dt: {bc}an object or device that is not essential in itself but adds to the beauty, convenience, or effectiveness of something else
{bc}a thing of secondary or lesser importance {bc}{sx|adjunct||}
{bc}a person not actually or constructively present but contributing as an assistant or instigator to the commission of an offense
{bc}a person who knowing that a crime has been committed aids or shelters the offender with intent to defeat justice

et: Middle English {it}accessorie, axcessary{/it} "person contributing to the commission of an offense," borrowed from Anglo-French {it}accessorie, accessoire{/it}, borrowed from Medieval Latin {it}accessōrius{/it} "person contributing to the commission of an offense, supplementary material," from Latin {it}access-{/it} (stem in derivation of {it}accēdere{/it} "to approach") + {it}-ōrius{/it} {et_link|-ory:1|-ory:1} {ma}{mat|accede|}{/ma}
shortdef: an object or device that is not essential in itself but adds to the beauty, convenience, or effectiveness of something else
a thing of secondary or lesser importance : adjunct
a person not actually or constructively present but contributing as an assistant or instigator to the commission of an offense —called also accessory before the fact
